text: i'll kick things off. <@U02EG84B5UL> i'm curious about getting buy-in for your ideas. i remember early in my career pitching what i thought were really good ideas and i felt like no one listened. a few years later, i pitched some of the exact same ideas and they resonated. i didn't know what to attribute this to besides just time. any thoughts on getting people to pay attention??

text: <@U02EG84B5UL> Do you see a demand for soft skills in your education business? I assume FTF looks more at "hard" skills for marketersâ€”let me know if that assumption is wrong and if/how you view/approach soft skills (e.g. leadership, storytelling, emotional intelligence,  etc).

text: <@U02EG84B5UL> You had me at "getting past 'we need leads'." I'm always interested to hear people's perspectives on changing the marketing narrative a bit. How do you emphasize the importance of building brand awareness, authority, and affinity?

text: Hey <@U02EG84B5UL> :wave: I have a question from your intro video about how Unbounce educated their audience on the value of content. Iâ€™m trying to understand how you convince people to care about something they may have not of heard of before :joy:

In other words once you have the content dept humming, how do you make sure that work impacts the business?

text: Hi <@U02EG84B5UL> :wave: I'm interested in knowing more about customer research to guide content production. Do you follow a specific method, scheme or workflow to conduct and process the research? How does it translate then into the content itself?

elements.text: Hi

I'm interested in knowing more about customer research to guide content production. Do you follow a specific method, scheme or workflow to conduct and process the research? How does it translate then into the content itself?

text:
This is soooo, so, so helpful, thank you! Apologies for not filling in more gaps for youâ€¦Iâ€™m the sole dedicated content marketer sitting on a larger marketing team, and I do have buy-in to expand the content team :slightly_smiling_face:

I feel like Iâ€™m in a similar situation - the blog is the main piece I would feel good about handing off to someone else at this point in time. Our growth team in the process of some hefty customer research though, so I love your recommendation to take what we learn from that and apply it to how we choose to scale. 

Seriously, so helpful! Thanks a bunch.

text:
Thanks <@U02EG84B5UL> - Sorry, I used to be a phonetician/linguist (at McGill actually!) so my personal weakness is telling people about the way they speak.

Helpful advice, thanks! I guess I shouldn't say new because I've been in my role for over a year now, but I especially appreciate the advice to use that same language when speaking to my team as I do to leadership.

elements.text: Thanks

Helpful advice, thanks! I guess I shouldn't say new because I've been in my role for over a year now, but I especially appreciate the advice to use that same language when speaking to my team as I do to leadership.
